meanings.definition: The act of dissipating or dispersing
meanings.sent1: The dissipation of the clouds allowed the sun to shine through.
meanings.sent2: The dissipation of the crowd after the concert was gradual.
meanings.sent3: The dissipation of the bubbles in the bath made a funny sound.
meanings.sent4: The dissipation of rumors in a small town is like trying to catch smoke.
meanings.sent5: The dissipation of the mist revealed a stunning view of the valley.

meanings.sent1: The dissipation of money on unnecessary items left him broke.
meanings.sent2: Her dissipation of resources on frivolous things was concerning.
meanings.sent3: The dissipation of snacks at the party was excessive.
meanings.sent4: The dissipation of time on trivial matters is regrettable.
meanings.sent5: The dissipation of energy on fruitless tasks is unproductive.

meanings.definition: The process of losing energy or power
meanings.sent1: The dissipation of heat from the engine was noticeable.
meanings.sent2: The dissipation of strength due to illness was evident.
meanings.sent3: The dissipation of enthusiasm for the project was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The dissipation of motivation can be challenging to overcome.
meanings.sent5: The dissipation of light as it fades into the horizon is beautiful.
